attributes.additional_details:
The public put faith into our politicians to debate their policies appropriately. It is childish and inappropriate that MP's within the House of Commons insist on shouting when each side of the opposition is debating policies.

This results in an unhealthy debate and really undermines the professionalism of politicians.

The undersigned agree that the House of Commons should implement rules regarding the attitude and behaviour of MP's within the House of Commons, that control their childish and distracting 'shouty attitude'.

rejection.details: This is a matter for the House, not for Government
